intro.description:
In addition to plotting your recorded vehicle data, Debrief is able to show a number of datasets in backdrop form.
These range from Vectored datasets such as VPF through to gridded datasets such as ETOPO-2

item.title: Locating the coastline file
item.description:
In your Debrief installation directory is a file named world.dat. This is a fairly coarse global coastline. For Debrief to plot coastlines we need to tell Debrief where the file is.
So, go into Window/Preferences, then open up Maritime Analysis, then Coastline file location. Lastly, click on Browse to navigate to the World.dat file in your Debrief installation folder.

item.title: How to configure VPF library datasets
item.description:
The steps to configure VPF and Etopo are covered in Debrief's user manual. NoPrintIf you wish to learn this at this stage, use the 'Question Mark' help link alongside, else search for VPF in Debrief's online help at some future stage.NoPrint Here's a clue though, you go into the Maritime Analysis section of the Preferences.
VPF is distributed as 4 CD-ROMS. If you don't hold the CDs you can skip this step.

item.title: How to configure ETOPO library data
item.description:
NoPrint Use the help link to the side of this text to open the guidance on how to configure the location of the ETOPO data. NoPrint Please read the relevant section of the Debrief user manual for how to specify use the Debrief/Preferences dialog the location of the ETOPO dataset.
